page.title: 02Religion in Lorton
page.content: St. Cuthbert's is part of a united benefice working under one vicar but with some services taken by lay people The Church frequently hosts musical concerts with artists from the Northern Sinfonia and are always well attended. At least one service is held each Sunday and the congregation averages 25, a high proportion of the population. The Alternative Service book has been introduced alongside the Book of Common Prayer to cater for different tastes. Services at Christmas,Easter and Harvest have high attendances which are growing each year.All babies born here are baptised The first confirmation for six years takes place this year. All young folk getting married still choose a church wedding. Over 90% of people who die are buried in the churchyard, few being cremated.
